prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Maggey Byrde
Description: A waitress at Tres Bien. Was found guilty of murder thanks to the phony me.
Character 5
Name: Jean Armstrong
Description: Tres Bien's owner and chef. A witness in the case who is also into aromatherapy.
Character 6
Name: Glen Elg
Description: The victim. Was a programmer. Maggey had apparently never even seen him before.
Character 7
Name: Victor Kudo
Description: Was in Tres Bien at the time of the incident. Has a thing for waitresses.
Character 8
Name: Lisa Basil
Description: The CEO of Blue Screens, Inc., and Glen Elg's boss. Absolutely not a robot.
Character 9
Name: Violetta → Viola Cadaverini
Description: Possibly part of the staff at Tender Lender? A thoroughly bitter person.
Character 10
Name: Furio Tigre
Description: The head of Tender Lender loan company. Also known as "The Tiger".
Character 11
Name: Bruto Cadaverini
Description: The head of the Cadaverini Family crime syndicate. Seems to live for his granddaughter.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts. On loan from Maya. Recovered in the kitchen of Tres Bien.
Evidence 2
Name: Magazine Clipping
Description: An article from December 5th. Says I was trounced and my client was found guilty.
Evidence 3
Name: Sports Paper
Description: Dates from December 3rd, the day of the incident. On it is a doodle that said 'MC Bomber' with an arrow pointing to '100,000' that was crossed out. 'Ahahahaha' and a laughing face are written next to it. Left by a costumer in Tres Bien on Dec. 3rd. Left by the victim. Doodle is in victim's handwriting.
Evidence 4
Name: Job Listings
Description: Picked up from a bench in Vitamin Square. Thrown away by the old man.
Evidence 5
Name: Lunch Special
Description: Tres Bien lunch special. Costs 20 dollars despite how unbelievably bad it tastes.
Evidence 6
Name: Small Bottle
Description: Found in the kitchen. Shape is different from the others bottles. Contents unknown. The victim's ear medicine. Found covered in unidentified fingerprints in the kitchen. The victim's ear medicine. Covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints.
Evidence 7
Name: Scooter
Description: Ridden by my phony. The wheel guard is all smashed up.
Evidence 8
Name: Jean's Loan Contract
Description: Jean's debt is half a million dollars. The owner of the loan is Tender Lender.
Evidence 9
Name: Victor's Note
Description: "Convicted before, a wicked man or woman, repeat offender -- Victor Kudo"
Evidence 10
Name: Glen's Autopsy Report
Description: Died of potassium cyanide poisoning. Time of death was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM.
Evidence 11
Name: Tres Bien Floor Plans
Description: Blueprints of the crime scene. [caption] The view from the entrance is obstructed and could only see the patio.
Evidence 12
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the scene taken from near the kitchen. [caption] Two dining tables are separated by a folding screen. The one closer to the camera is empty. The other one is where the victim collapse on the table. There is an intact vase on each table. A coffee cup is knocked over and the the table cloth is stained by coffee. Near the coffee table are some pieces of papers. No one is sitting across from the victim.
Evidence 13
Name: Coffee Cup
Description: The coffee contained potassium cyanide. Covered in the victim and Maggey's fingerprints.
Evidence 14
Name: Victim's Lottery Ticket
Description: A winning ticket for half a million dollars. Found during a body search of Maggey.
Evidence 15
Name: Apron
Description: Worn by Maggey at the time of the incident. Has small pockets but big stains.
Evidence 16
Name: Potassium Cyanide
Description: A deadly powdery poison. Bears Maggey's fingerprints. Found in her apron pocket.
Evidence 17
Name: Victim's Prescription Bag
Description: The victim got this from the doctor before going to Tres Bien. The bag is empty.
Evidence 18
Name: Victor's Testimony
Description: "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry."
Evidence 19
Name: Millionaire Radio Flyer
Description: Experience the most thrilling ten minutes of your life every Monday at 1:30 PM!
Evidence 20
Name: Glen's Calendar
Description: On Dec. 3rd, the day of the incident, there is a note saying, "Meet with The Tiger".
Evidence 21
Name: Losing Horse Racing Tickets
Description: Horse racing betting tickets. Found in Glen Elg's desk. There's over 500 of them!
Evidence 22
Name: Gumshoe's Lunchbox
Description: A tenderly handmade lunchbox. Fills the stomach with love and plenty of weenies.
Evidence 23
Name: MC Bomber
Description: Found at Tender Lender. A sample disc with the name written in marker. Found at Tender Lender. Contains a computer virus program. A computer virus made by Glen Elg. Potentially worth million of dollars.
Evidence 24
Name: Tres Bien Matches
Description: Matches used for advertising. Found lying in Tender Lender.
Evidence 25
Name: Repair Bill
Description: A car repair bill for $15,000. Paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family.
Evidence 26
Name: Paper Badge
Description: Found at Tender Lender. Made of cardboard and painted to look authentic.
Evidence 27
Name: Viola's Medical Papers
Description: A 1 million dollar bill for cranial surgery. Payment was due last year.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: La mirror, it was in z'e middle of la restaurant, dividing z'e two 'alves.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 1
Testimony: Z'ere is only one seat from which you could 'ave seen an image of la victim.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 2
Testimony: Z'at was la seat at z'e table next to la victim's. Z'at was where la old man was sitting.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 3
Testimony: After la terrible incident occurred, I move la mirror so it was not in z'e way.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 4
Testimony: But naturally, I did not touch anything else!
Person: Armstrong

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let me start by going through the characters, evidences, and testimonies provided.

First, looking at the testimonies from Jean Armstrong (Character 5). His testimonies mention a mirror in the restaurant that divided the two halves, and that the only seat from which someone could see the victim was the table next to the victim's, where an old man was sitting. He also says he moved the mirror after the incident but didn't touch anything else.

Now, looking at the evidences, especially the ones related to the crime scene. Evidence 11 is the Tres Bien Floor Plans, which describes the crime scene's layout. The caption says, "The view from the entrance is obstructed and could only see the patio." Evidence 12 is the Crime Photo, which mentions that two dining tables are separated by a folding screen. The photo's caption states there's a folding screen between the tables, and the victim's table has an intact vase, a knocked-over coffee cup, etc., with no one sitting across from him.

Wait, the key here might be the folding screen versus the mirror. Armstrong's testimony talks about a mirror dividing the two halves of the restaurant, but the floor plan (Evidence 11) says the view from the entrance is obstructed by something, possibly the screen mentioned in Evidence 12. The Crime Photo (Evidence 12) specifically mentions a folding screen separating the tables, not a mirror. 

So, if Armstrong says there was a mirror dividing the restaurant, but the evidence shows a folding screen, that's a contradiction. Let me check the testimonies again. Testimony 0 from Armstrong says the mirror was in the middle dividing the two halves. But the floor plan (Evidence 11) and the crime photo (Evidence 12) both mention a folding screen, not a mirror. Therefore, the testimony about the mirror contradicts the evidence showing a folding screen. 

The correct pair would be Evidence 12 (Crime Photo describing the folding screen) and Testimony 0 (Armstrong's statement about the mirror). Alternatively, maybe Evidence 11 (floor plans) also mentions the screen. Let me check Evidence 11's description again: "Blueprints of the crime scene. [caption] The view from the entrance is obstructed and could only see the patio." The caption in Evidence 12 explicitly mentions the folding screen. 

So the contradiction is between Testimony 0 (mirror) and Evidence 12 (folding screen). Therefore, the answer should be Evidence 12 and Testimony 0. Wait, but the user might have different numbering. Let me confirm the evidence numbers. 

Evidence 12 is the Crime Photo, which mentions the folding screen. Testimony 0 is from Armstrong about the mirror. So the contradiction is between Evidence 12 and Testimony 0. But the user's instruction says to output one pair. Let me check if there's another possible pair. 

Alternatively, Testimony 1 says the only seat from which you could see the victim was next to him. But if the screen is there, maybe that's conflicting? Not sure. The main contradiction is mirror vs. screen. So the correct pair is Evidence 12 and Testimony 0. Therefore, the JSON should be {"evidence":12, "testimony":0}.
</think>

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let's start by going through the testimonies and evidences one by one to spot any inconsistencies.

First, looking at the testimonies from Jean Armstrong (Character 5):

Testimony 0: The victim, Glen Elg, came alone to the restaurant. Testimony 1 and 2 mention an old man arriving after Glen, around 2 PM. Testimony 3 states there were no other customers besides them. So according to Armstrong, only Glen and the old man were present.

Now, let's check the evidences. Evidence 7 is the Scooter, which was ridden by the "phony" (the impostor who framed Maggey). The description says the scooter's wheel guard is smashed up. This suggests that someone (the phony) used this scooter, implying there was a third person involved—the phony themselves. 

If Armstrong's testimony (Testimony 3) says there were no other customers, but Evidence 7 indicates the presence of a phony who must have been there, that's a contradiction. The phony would be an additional person not accounted for in Armstrong's statement. 

Wait, but Testimony 6 from Armstrong says there was no time for a phony to act. That also ties in. If the phony was present, that contradicts the "no other customers" claim. 

Another point: Evidence 22 is Gumshoe's Lunchbox, but that might not be relevant here. Evidence 4 is Job Listings thrown away by the old man. The old man is mentioned in the testimonies, so he's accounted for. The phony, however, isn't mentioned as a customer but as someone else. 

The key contradiction is between Testimony 3 (no other customers) and Evidence 7 (the phony's scooter implies the phony was present, making them another customer or intruder). Therefore, the pair would be Evidence 7 and Testimony 3.
</think>

cot:
Okay, let's see what the problem is here. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I need to find a pair that contradicts each other. The answer should be in JSON format with the evidence and testimony numbers.

First, I'll go through the characters to get a sense of who's involved. The key people here are Maggey Byrde (the defendant), Glen Elg (the victim), and Furio Tigre (The Tiger from Tender Lender). The testimonies given are from Furio Tigre, where he claims he was in his office on the day of the incident and didn't see the victim. 

Looking at the evidences, I need to find something that conflicts with his testimony. Let me check each evidence one by one. 

Evidence 20 is Glen's Calendar, which has a note saying "Meet with The Tiger" on December 3rd, the day of the incident. If Glen had a meeting scheduled with Tigre that day, that directly contradicts Tigre's testimony that he was in his office all day and never saw the victim. Tigre says he didn't meet Glen, but the calendar shows Glen planned to meet him. That's a clear contradiction.

I should check if there's any other evidence that might conflict, but Evidence 20 seems like the strongest candidate. The other testimonies from Tigre mention being in the office and not knowing the victim, but the calendar evidence directly links Tigre to a scheduled meeting with Glen, which he denies. So the pair is Evidence 20 and Testimony 2.
</think>

Description: The coffee contained potassium cyanide. Covered in the victim and Maggey's fingerprints.

Name: Apron

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let me start by going through the evidence and testimonies one by one.

First, looking at the testimonies from Furio Tigre (Character 10). His testimonies are Testimony 0 to 4. Let's check each:

Testimony 0: "I ain't no liar. I never met Glen Elg." But Evidence 20 is Glen's Calendar which says he had a note to meet "The Tiger" on the incident date. Since Furio is "The Tiger" (as per his character description), that would mean Glen did meet him, contradicting Testimony 0.

Testimony 1: Tigre mentions setting up a meeting at his office, but Testimony 3 says Glen never showed. However, the calendar shows Glen planned to meet, so maybe he did go but the meeting was elsewhere?

Wait, the key point here is Testimony 4 where Tigre says he never went to Tres Bien. But Evidence 20's calendar note says Glen was supposed to meet "The Tiger" (Tigre) on that day. If the meeting was at Tres Bien where the crime happened, then Tigre's claim of never being there contradicts that. 

Looking at Testimony 2: Tigre says he set up the meeting at his office, Tender Lender. But the calendar says "Meet with The Tiger" without a location. If the meeting was actually at Tres Bien, then Testimony 2 is false. But the evidence doesn't explicitly say the meeting location. Hmm.

Alternatively, Evidence 20's note is on Glen's calendar, so if the meeting was supposed to be at Tender Lender's office, then Tigre's Testimony 3 (Glen didn't show) might align. But the crime happened at Tres Bien. Wait, the problem is the contradiction between Testimony 4 ("never been to Tres Bien") and the fact that Glen's calendar shows a meeting with Tigre. If the meeting was at Tres Bien, then Tigre would have been there, contradicting Testimony 4. But if the meeting was elsewhere, then maybe not. 

Alternatively, Evidence 25 is a repair bill paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family. Not sure how that connects.

Wait, the key is Testimony 4 where Tigre denies ever being at Tres Bien. But Evidence 20's calendar note from Glen says he was supposed to meet Tigre on that day. If the meeting location was Tres Bien, then Tigre must have been there, contradicting his testimony. But the calendar doesn't specify the location. However, since the murder happened at Tres Bien, maybe the meeting was there. Alternatively, maybe the meeting was at Tender Lender, but the calendar just says "Meet with The Tiger" without location. 

Alternatively, maybe the fact that Glen's calendar has the meeting note implies that he intended to meet Tigre, which would require Tigre to be present somewhere, but Tigre's testimony says he was at his office. However, Testimony 2 says he set up the meeting at his office, so maybe the contradiction is that Glen's calendar says to meet Tigre, but Tigre claims Glen didn't show. But that's between Tigre's testimony and the calendar's existence, not directly contradicting each other. 

Wait, maybe Testimony 3 says Tigre waited but Glen didn't show. But the autopsy report (Evidence 10) says Glen died between 1:30 and 2:30 PM. If the meeting was scheduled around that time, then Glen couldn't have shown because he was already dead. So maybe the meeting time was the same as when he was poisoned, so he couldn't make it, which aligns with Testimony 3. Not a contradiction there.

Hmm, maybe another angle. Evidence 25 is a repair bill paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family. Not sure how that ties in.

Wait, looking back at Testimony 4: Tigre says he never went to Tres Bien. But Evidence 24: Tres Bien Matches were found at Tender Lender. Maybe that implies someone from Tender Lender was at Tres Bien, but not necessarily Tigre. 

Alternatively, Evidence 20's calendar note suggests Glen was meeting Tigre on that day. If the meeting was at Tres Bien, then Tigre must have been there, contradicting his Testimony 4. Since the crime occurred at Tres Bien, perhaps the meeting was there. The problem is the calendar doesn't specify location, but maybe it's implied. 

Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 20 (Glen's calendar showing a meeting with Tigre on the day) and Testimony 4 (Tigre claims he never went to Tres Bien). If the meeting was at Tres Bien, then Testimony 4 is false. Since the murder happened there, maybe the meeting was there, leading to the contradiction.
</think>

cot:

But perhaps there's another contradiction.

Wait, looking at Evidence 25: the repair bill paid by Tigre to Cadaverini Family. Not sure how that connects. Let me re-examine the testimonies and evidence again.

Wait, Testimony 4 says after hearing sirens, Tigre went straight back to his office. If the meeting was supposed to be at the restaurant (as per Testimony 0), but the calendar (Evidence 20) might indicate the meeting location? The calendar only notes the meeting, not the location. If Tigre's testimony claims he went to the restaurant, but Evidence 20's note doesn't specify location, maybe there's another angle.

Alternatively, perhaps the contradiction is between Evidence 20 and Testimony 0. Wait, no, because Testimony 0 says he was supposed to meet at the restaurant. Evidence 20's calendar note just says "Meet with The Tiger" without location, so that's consistent. Hmm, maybe I'm missing something else.

Wait, looking at Testimony 3, Tigre says he split because the place was hot (meaning crime scene), implying he was there. But if the meeting was supposed to be at the restaurant, then his presence there would make sense. However, the autopsy report (Evidence 10) says time of death was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM. If Tigre's testimony says he went there that afternoon, maybe the timing aligns. Not sure yet.

Wait, perhaps looking at Evidence 25: the repair bill paid by Tigre. If the bill is from around the time of the incident, maybe Tigre was involved in a car repair that contradicts his alibi. But the testimony doesn't mention the car. Alternatively, maybe Testimony 4 says he went back to his office after the incident. If the repair bill was paid around that time, maybe he was elsewhere. But without more info, this might not be the best pair.

Wait, let's check Testimony 0 again: Tigre says he was supposed to meet Glen at the restaurant that afternoon. Evidence 20's calendar note "Meet with The Tiger" on Dec 3rd. So that matches. But Testimony 4 says after the incident, he went back to his office. If the meeting was at the restaurant, then his presence there would mean he was at the scene, which might conflict with other evidence. 

Wait, the victim's calendar (Evidence 20) says "Meet with The Tiger", implying the meeting was with Furio Tigre. If Tigre was at the restaurant (as per his testimony), then he would have been present when Glen was there, but the autopsy time is 1:30-2:30 PM. If the meeting was at that time, then Tigre's presence there would be during the time of death. But the testimony says he found Glen dead, implying he arrived after the death. However, the autopsy's time frame might conflict if Tigre's arrival time is inconsistent. But without exact times in testimony, maybe that's a stretch.

Alternatively, perhaps the contradiction is between Evidence 20 and Testimony 4. Wait, no. Let me think again. 

Wait, in Testimony 0, Tigre says he was supposed to meet Glen at the restaurant that afternoon. Evidence 20's calendar note supports that meeting. But in Testimony 4, he says after hearing sirens, he went back to his office. If the meeting was at the restaurant, then he was there, but maybe Evidence 25's repair bill paid by Tigre to Cadaverini Family (the syndicate) might indicate he was involved in some other activity conflicting with his alibi. However, without direct link, that's unclear.

Wait, perhaps there's another evidence. Let me check Evidence 6: the small bottle in the kitchen has Furio Tigre's fingerprints. If Tigre was at the scene (the restaurant), then his fingerprints on the bottle would make sense. But if he claims he only went there after the incident, then how did his fingerprints get on an item in the kitchen? That could be a contradiction.

Ah! Evidence 6 states the small bottle's fingerprints are Furio Tigre's. If Testimony 0 says he went to the restaurant after the incident (to see the body), but the bottle was in the kitchen, then his fingerprints there would imply he was there before the incident, contradicting his testimony that he only arrived after. 

Wait, Testimony 0 says he was supposed to meet Glen at the restaurant that afternoon. Testimony 1 says when he opened the door, he saw the scene. So he arrived after the murder. But if his fingerprints are on a bottle in the kitchen, that would mean he was there earlier, possibly before the murder, which contradicts his testimony of arriving after. 

Therefore, Evidence 6 (bottle with Tigre's fingerprints) contradicts Testimony 0 (claiming he went to the restaurant after the incident). 

Wait, but the Testimony 0 says he was supposed to meet at the restaurant that afternoon. If the meeting was scheduled, he might have been there earlier, but according to his testimony, he arrived after the murder. The fingerprints on the bottle would indicate prior presence, which contradicts his testimony that he only arrived after. 

Alternatively, maybe Testimony 0 is about the scheduled meeting, but he didn't go until after. The fingerprints would mean he was there before, which would conflict with his testimony that he only arrived after the incident. 

Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 6 and Testimony 0. But let me double-check the numbers.

Evidence 6 is the small bottle with Furio Tigre's fingerprints. Testimony 0 is Tigre's testimony about the meeting. 

Wait, Testimony 0 is "I was supposed to meet wid the kid at the restaurant that afternoon." So he was supposed to meet there, but according to his testimony, when he arrived, the victim was already dead. However, his fingerprints on the bottle in the kitchen suggest he was there earlier, perhaps before the murder. This would contradict his testimony that he only arrived after the incident. 

Therefore, the correct pair is Evidence 6 and Testimony 0. But let me check other possibilities to be sure.

Another possibility: Testimony 4 says after hearing sirens, he went back to his office. If the repair bill (Evidence 25) was paid around that time, maybe he was elsewhere. But that's speculative.

Alternatively, Evidence 20 shows Glen's calendar had the meeting with Tigre. If Tigre's testimony about being at the restaurant aligns with that, then no contradiction there. The key contradiction is the fingerprints on the bottle implying prior presence versus his testimony of arriving after the murder.

Yes, I think that's the main contradiction. So the answer would be {"evidence":6, "testimony":0}. Wait, but let me confirm the evidence numbers again.

Evidence 6: Small Bottle description says "The victim's ear medicine. Found covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints." 

Testimony 0: Tigre says he went to the restaurant after the incident (since he saw the victim dead). If he was there before, his fingerprints would be there. So the evidence shows he touched the bottle (in the kitchen), implying he was there before the murder, contradicting his testimony that he only arrived after. Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 6 and Testimony 0.
